history.content:
Stat 89A/EE16AB, Math 53, Math 110, EE126, EE127. Stat 89A is like EE16AB in 1 semester instead of 2 (but w/o differential equations)

_____________________________

I would suggest you to take EECS 126 instead of Stat 140 (as it would definitely be more helpful in preparation for 189 and would also be a smooth transition from CS 70), and any of the linear algebra options mentioned above. Linear algebra is at the core of ML and gaining mastery of that would be essential for 189.
Stat 89A/EE16AB, Math 53, Math 110, EE126, EE127. Stat 89A is like EE16AB in 1 semester instead of 2 (but w/o differential equations)

I am currently a sophomore looking to take cs189 next spring 2019. Currently I have/am taking Math 54, cs70, cs170, data 100, cs188.

I am planning to take Stat 140 and 61C this fall 2018. I have space for 1 more technical. 

Any recommendations for a third technical to best prepare for cs189 the following semester? Or would I need even more prep?

I have not taken Math 53 and don't have a calculus background (outside of ap calc in high school). I also read that Math 110 can be helpful. How crucial are calculus and linear algebra for cs189. Which class (53 or 110) would be more reasonable to self-study? which class would be more useful to know beyond 189, if either?

thanks!
history.subject: Best Classes to Prepare for CS189
